abstractContent.text: This tutorial will cover recent advances in sparse modeling with diverse applications in natural language processing (NLP).
A sparse model is one that uses a relatively small number of features to map an input to an output, such as a label sequence or parse tree.
The advantages of sparsity are, among others, compactness and interpretability; in fact, sparsity is currently a major theme in statistics, machine learning, and signal processing.
The goal of sparsity can be seen in terms of earlier goals of feature selection and therefore model selection (Della Pietra et al.
